info.name: Economic Ecosystem
info.description: The broader economic and institutional environment including financial capital markets, talent markets, regulatory systems, customer networks, and stakeholder value chains. This environment demonstrates how organizations exist within complex economic networks where capital flows, regulatory frameworks, market dynamics, and institutional relationships create the context for organizational operation and value creation.

info.name: Financial Capital Market
info.description: External investors, banks, and capital markets providing financial resources for operations, growth, and strategic initiatives. Represents the organization's connection to the broader economic ecosystem and its dependency on external funding sources.

info.name: Talent Market
info.description: External labor market providing skilled professionals, specialists, and workforce capacity. Demonstrates how organizations must compete for human capital and adapt to changing skill requirements in the knowledge economy.

info.name: Regulatory Compliance Systems
info.description: Government agencies, industry regulators, and compliance frameworks that require organizational reporting, procedures, and adherence to standards. Represents the institutional environment that constrains organizational behavior.

info.name: Stakeholder Value Network
info.description: Employees receiving compensation, shareholders receiving returns, suppliers receiving payments, and communities receiving economic benefits. Shows how organizations distribute created value across multiple stakeholder groups.

info.name: Organizational Knowledge Base
info.description: Institutional memory, best practices, and lessons learned that accumulate from both successful and failed initiatives. Represents the organization's capacity for adaptive learning and continuous improvement.

info.name: Market/Customer Network
info.description: External customers, clients, and market segments that receive products, services, and value propositions. Represents the organization's primary purpose - creating and delivering value to its served markets.

info.name: Human Resources Department
info.description: Talent management subsystem responsible for workforce planning, recruitment, development, retention, and organizational culture. Transforms raw human capital from labor markets into organized, productive teams aligned with strategic objectives. Demonstrates how organizations systematically develop their most critical resource.

info.name: HR Operations Boundary
info.description: Defines human capital management scope including talent acquisition, performance management, compensation systems, and cultural development. Acts as the interface between individual employee needs and organizational strategic requirements.

info.name: Talent Analytics Dashboard
info.description: Performance metrics and workforce analytics reporting system feeding strategic workforce planning

interfaces.protocol: 1. Employee data aggregated → 2. Performance metrics calculated → 3. Trend analysis performed → 4. Strategic insights generated → 5. Dashboard updated for executive review

info.name: Sales & Customer Success Department
info.description: Revenue generation and customer relationship subsystem responsible for market engagement, value delivery, and customer satisfaction. Transforms organizational capabilities into market value through sales processes, service delivery, and ongoing customer success management.

info.name: Customer Interface Boundary
info.description: Defines all customer touchpoints including sales processes, service delivery mechanisms, customer support, and relationship management. Controls how the organization presents itself to and interacts with its market environment.

info.name: CRM Data Integration
info.description: Customer relationship and sales performance data flowing to strategic planning center

interfaces.protocol: 1. Customer interaction logged → 2. Sales data consolidated → 3. Performance KPIs calculated → 4. Market trends identified → 5. Strategic insights delivered

info.name: Finance & Accounting Department
info.description: Financial control and reporting subsystem managing cash flows, financial reporting, budgeting, and stakeholder payments. Transforms financial resources into organized capital allocation decisions while ensuring compliance with accounting standards and fiduciary responsibilities.

info.name: Financial Control Boundary
info.description: Defines financial authority including budget controls, payment authorizations, financial reporting standards, and audit compliance. Ensures financial integrity and regulatory compliance across all organizational activities.

info.name: Financial Analytics Platform
info.description: Real-time financial performance data and budget variance reports for strategic decision support

interfaces.protocol: 1. Financial transactions recorded → 2. Budget variance calculated → 3. Performance metrics generated → 4. Risk indicators assessed → 5. Executive dashboard updated

info.name: Innovation & Strategy Department
info.description: Strategic planning and innovation subsystem responsible for R&D, new product development, market analysis, and long-term planning. Transforms market intelligence and internal capabilities into strategic initiatives, managing the organization's adaptive capacity and future direction.

info.name: Innovation Boundary
info.description: Defines scope of strategic planning and innovation activities including research projects, market analysis, competitive intelligence, and new venture development. Balances exploratory activities with operational constraints.

info.name: Strategic Intelligence Feed
info.description: Market research, competitive analysis, and innovation pipeline status reporting to executive team

interfaces.protocol: 1. Market data collected → 2. Competitive analysis performed → 3. Innovation metrics assessed → 4. Strategic opportunities identified → 5. Executive briefing prepared

info.name: Executive Leadership Team
info.description: Strategic decision-making and organizational governance subsystem that integrates information from all departments to set direction, allocate resources, and coordinate organizational activities. Demonstrates Bertalanffy's principle of hierarchical control where higher-level systems regulate lower-level subsystem behavior through information processing and resource control.

info.name: Executive Control Boundary
info.description: Defines strategic authority including resource allocation, policy setting, performance standards, and organizational direction. Acts as the central information processor that coordinates departmental activities toward unified organizational objectives.

info.name: Executive Command Interface
info.description: Strategic directives and resource allocation decisions flowing to administrative operations

interfaces.protocol: 1. Strategic decision formulated → 2. Resource requirements assessed → 3. Implementation plan created → 4. Departmental directives issued → 5. Performance metrics established

info.name: HR Intelligence Interface
info.description: Workforce analytics and human capital status reports from HR operations

interfaces.protocol: 1. Workforce data received → 2. Performance trends analyzed → 3. Strategic implications assessed → 4. Resource allocation decisions made → 5. HR directives issued

info.name: Innovation Pipeline Interface
info.description: Strategic innovation directives and resource allocation for R&D initiatives

interfaces.protocol: 1. Innovation priorities set → 2. Resource allocation approved → 3. Strategic objectives communicated → 4. Performance targets established → 5. Progress monitoring initiated

info.name: Market Strategy Interface
info.description: Sales strategy directives and customer success priorities for market operations

interfaces.protocol: 1. Market strategy formulated → 2. Sales targets established → 3. Customer success priorities set → 4. Resource allocation approved → 5. Performance metrics defined

info.name: Financial Control Interface
info.description: Budget allocations and financial performance directives for finance operations

interfaces.protocol: 1. Budget parameters set → 2. Financial controls established → 3. Performance targets defined → 4. Resource allocation approved → 5. Compliance requirements communicated

info.name: Capital Strategy Interface
info.description: Investment priorities and capital allocation decisions from financial planning

interfaces.protocol: 1. Capital allocation data received → 2. Investment performance analyzed → 3. Strategic implications assessed → 4. Capital strategy adjusted → 5. Investment directives issued

info.name: Modern Business Organization
info.description: A complex adaptive system demonstrating Bertalanffy's principle that 'organizations are not mere collections of individuals but are systems of interrelated parts.' This organizational model illustrates Mobus's 7-tuple framework: components (departments), network (communication flows), governance (executive control), boundary (organizational policies), transformation (value creation), history (institutional memory), and time dynamics (strategic cycles). The organization exemplifies how purposeful human systems maintain coherence through hierarchical coordination while adapting to environmental pressures through distributed intelligence and feedback mechanisms.

info.name: Organizational Boundary
info.description: The legal, operational, and cultural boundaries that define organizational membership, authority, and responsibility. This 'effective boundary' (per Mobus) includes formal structures (legal incorporation, employment contracts) and informal elements (corporate culture, professional networks) that regulate information and resource flows between the organization and its environment.

info.name: Administrative Compliance Interface
info.description: Formal reporting and compliance systems managing regulatory requirements, legal obligations, and bureaucratic procedures

interfaces.protocol: 1. Regulatory requirement identified → 2. Compliance process initiated → 3. Documentation prepared → 4. Submission validated → 5. Compliance status updated

info.name: Financial Distribution Interface
info.description: Payment systems and financial distributions to stakeholders including employee compensation, shareholder dividends, supplier payments, and tax obligations

interfaces.protocol: 1. Payment authorization verified → 2. Financial instruments prepared → 3. Distribution executed → 4. Transaction recorded → 5. Stakeholder account updated

info.name: Knowledge Management Interface
info.description: Organizational learning systems that capture insights from projects, store institutional knowledge, and enable knowledge transfer

interfaces.protocol: 1. Learning opportunity identified → 2. Knowledge extracted and codified → 3. Best practices documented → 4. Knowledge base updated → 5. Access protocols established

info.name: Market Value Interface
info.description: Customer-facing systems delivering products, services, and value propositions to target markets through sales, service, and support channels

interfaces.protocol: 1. Customer need identified → 2. Value proposition developed → 3. Solution delivered → 4. Customer satisfaction measured → 5. Relationship maintained

info.name: Capital Acquisition Interface
info.description: Financial systems for raising capital, managing investor relations, and accessing credit markets for operational and strategic funding

interfaces.protocol: 1. Capital requirement assessed → 2. Funding source identified → 3. Financial proposal prepared → 4. Capital secured → 5. Financial obligations established

info.name: Talent Acquisition Interface
info.description: Recruitment and hiring systems that attract, evaluate, and onboard human capital from external labor markets

interfaces.protocol: 1. Talent need identified → 2. Candidate pool sourced → 3. Evaluation process conducted → 4. Selection decision made → 5. Onboarding completed

info.name: Corporate Finance Department
info.description: Strategic financial management subsystem responsible for capital structure, investment analysis, risk management, and financial planning. Transforms available capital into optimized resource allocation decisions that balance growth objectives with financial stability and stakeholder returns.

info.name: Capital Management Boundary
info.description: Defines financial strategy authority including investment decisions, capital structure optimization, risk management policies, and long-term financial planning. Controls how the organization deploys financial resources for maximum strategic impact.

info.name: Capital Allocation Analytics
info.description: Investment performance data and capital deployment recommendations for strategic planning

interfaces.protocol: 1. Investment opportunity analyzed → 2. Risk assessment completed → 3. Return projections calculated → 4. Capital allocation recommended → 5. Investment committee briefed

info.name: Operations & Administration Department
info.description: Administrative and operational support subsystem managing policies, procedures, facilities, legal compliance, and organizational infrastructure. Transforms regulatory requirements and operational needs into standardized processes and administrative systems that enable organizational function.

info.name: Administrative Operations Boundary
info.description: Defines operational support scope including policy administration, facilities management, legal compliance, information systems, and organizational infrastructure. Ensures operational continuity and regulatory compliance.

info.name: Administrative Coordination Interface
info.description: Operational status reports and administrative compliance updates to executive leadership

interfaces.protocol: 1. Administrative requirement identified → 2. Process compliance verified → 3. Status report generated → 4. Issue escalation assessed → 5. Executive notification delivered

info.name: Compliance Reports & Documentation
info.description: Regulatory filings, compliance reports, audit documentation, and bureaucratic paperwork required by external oversight bodies. Represents the administrative overhead necessary for organizational legitimacy and legal operation.

info.name: Stakeholder Value Distributions
info.description: Financial flows to stakeholders including employee salaries, executive compensation, shareholder dividends, supplier payments, and tax obligations. Demonstrates how organizations function as value distribution mechanisms within the broader economic system.

info.name: Organizational Learning & IP
info.description: Intellectual property, best practices, lessons learned, and institutional knowledge created through both successful initiatives and strategic failures. This knowledge becomes organizational assets that inform future decision-making and competitive advantage.

info.name: Products & Services
info.description: Market offerings that deliver value to customers - including physical products, professional services, digital solutions, and customer experiences. Represents the organization's primary value creation and the reason for its market existence.

info.name: Operating Capital & Investment
info.description: Financial resources from investors, lenders, and capital markets that fund operations, growth initiatives, and strategic investments. Includes equity investments, debt financing, lines of credit, and reinvested earnings.

info.name: Human Capital & Expertise
info.description: Professional skills, knowledge, experience, creativity, and work capacity provided by employees across all organizational levels. Includes specialized expertise, leadership capabilities, institutional knowledge, and collaborative capacity.

info.name: Capital Investment Analytics
info.description: Financial analysis, investment performance metrics, and capital allocation recommendations that inform strategic resource deployment decisions. Enables the executive team to optimize financial resource allocation across competing strategic priorities.

info.name: Workforce Intelligence Reports
info.description: Human capital analytics including performance metrics, retention rates, skill assessments, and workforce planning data that inform strategic talent management decisions. Enables data-driven human capital optimization.

info.name: Innovation Strategy Directives
info.description: Strategic priorities, resource allocations, and performance targets for R&D and innovation initiatives. Represents top-down strategic control where executive decisions guide exploratory activities and new venture development.

info.name: Sales & Market Strategy
info.description: Strategic direction for customer acquisition, market positioning, pricing strategies, and customer success initiatives. Translates organizational strategic objectives into market-facing operational priorities and performance targets.

info.name: Financial Control Directives
info.description: Budget allocations, financial policies, and performance targets that guide financial operations and ensure fiscal discipline. Represents hierarchical financial control where strategic priorities drive operational financial management.

info.name: Administrative Policy Directives
info.description: Organizational policies, operational procedures, and administrative standards that ensure consistent operations and regulatory compliance across all organizational activities. Demonstrates how high-level governance translates into operational control.
